Posts.Content: Kindergarten wrote: hi, everyone !! I am almost 11 years out from breast cancer!! My dermatologist found a suspicious mole on my back!! She did a biopsy and found malignant squamous skin celss !! Any info or advice?? Kathy Dx 11/17/2004, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/28 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 12/5/2004 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/29/2005 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic ovary removal Radiation Therapy 6/5/2005 Breast Dx IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/28 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Squamous skin cancer Kindergarten MusicLover

Posts.Content: Kindergarten wrote: Hi, everyone, I am Stage 2b, cancer free for over 6 years and had no problems until last week. I was admitted to the hospital last week with an aggresive case of cellulitis. The infectious disease doctor told me my immune system had literally crashed and when I told hime I was taking aromasin, he said that that drug can definitely compromise my immune system. Any one out there have a similiar experience or ideas??? Thanks for your input and God bless you, Kathy Kathy Dx 11/17/2004, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/28 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 12/5/2004 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/29/2005 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic ovary removal Radiation Therapy 6/5/2005 Breast Dx IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/28 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cellulitis Kindergarten Kindergarten

Posts.Content: Kindergarten wrote: Hi, My name is Kathy and I am new to this site. You are all amazing. I am not Stage 4 yet, but had bilateral breast cancer which is pretty unusual and thought you all might be interested in my case. I was a stage 2b with one positive lymph node. Please contact me if you have any questions. I was treated at Magee Hospital in Pittsburgh, Pa with chemo first, then double mastectomy and then radiation. I am currently on exemestane andmy question is how high should your AST and ALt get before I get concerned. They seem to rise every six months. My current AST is 31 up from 20 and my ALT is 48 up from 30. My onc does not seem too worried but I would like to have an ultrasound. Any out there with similiar scores. Worried about liver mets. Thanks for all your help, Kathy Kathy Dx 11/17/2004, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/28 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 12/5/2004 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 5/29/2005 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic ovary removal Radiation Therapy 6/5/2005 Breast Dx IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/28 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
